This is awful - the patient had #MultipleSclerosis and asked for the #COVID19 #Vaccine - she was told she could not get vaccinated because it contained ‚Äúlive virus‚Äù (this is false) - she got #COVID19 & was denied mAbs too. She died and family is suing.

Just because we are tired of #COVID19 is not a reason to lift all the mitigation strategies. 

The virus continues to cause record numbers of cases and is the perfect situation for another variant to emerge.

Organs are scarce and as someone who worked in #Transplant #ID - we list those who have the greatest chance of survival while optimizing their results-that includes getting #vaccinated against various infections (not just #COVID19) to ‚¨áÔ∏è risk of infection post transplant https://t.co/D5dhEQspJY

Staggering statistics regarding #COVID19 

100 cases reported every 3 seconds and a death every 12 seconds

On average 5 people died every minute from #COVID19.

Those saying this is the end of the #pandemic or COVID is #endemic look at these numbers - we are not at the end yet. https://t.co/CeSFWQd6n8

As the #COVID19 #pandemic enters its 3rd year I am struck by the increasing vitriol and division I see everywhere. 

People are dying, exhausted and traumatized.

We all need to heal and life is too short. Let‚Äôs stop fighting, come together and be kind to one another.

On Jan 15th #COVAX delivered its 1 billionth #COVID19 #vaccine dose. 

Despite this, 85% of the African Union population has not received any vaccine doses. 

36 of 194 @WHO member states have yet to vaccinate 10% of their population 

How can we talk about the pandemic ending?

As #COVID19 and #Omicron take over #India I worry the narrative that Omicron causes "mild" infection is going to be harmful to way that the people and government prepare.

Please note from the experiences of other countries and prepare the healthcare system for what is to come. https://t.co/gz2QzpOz39
Just because there are some vocal few saying #COVID19 is #endemic doesn‚Äôt actually make it true

We keep talking about #VaccinEquity but with an ‚¨ÜÔ∏è number of therapeutics available for #COVID19 (corticosteroids, IL-6 RB, JAK inhibitors, monoclonal antibodies, antivirals and others on the horizon) it‚Äôs important to discuss  equity and fairness of therapeutic distribution.

In case you still doubt the efficacy of #CovidVaccines then look at data from #Switzerland reporting #mortality based on #vaccination status 

Compared to unvaccinated the #COVID19 mortality rate is 
- 9x ‚¨áÔ∏è after full vaccination 
- 48x ‚¨áÔ∏è after booster 

#VaccinesSaveLives https://t.co/a6kaHCSH0W

#COVID19 is NOT #endemic and this is a dangerous false narrative 

The US accounts for the most cases globally with deaths at the highest  in a year. 

Globally over the last 7 days we have had record number of cases

 This is not what endemic looks like  https://t.co/VNoHgLrwL8

If you live in #SanFrancisco and have #COVID19 they will pay you $1000 to #StayHome so you don‚Äôt infect anyone else. 

This is great harm reduction and is other places should consider. It allows people to take paid sick leave, care for themselves and prevent onward transmission. https://t.co/QMP4FoyRBd

This is what leadership looks like @jacindaardern walks the talk  amid a surge of #Omicron in #NewZealand - imagine if we had a world where all of our leaders did this. 

Maybe #COVID19 wouldn‚Äôt be the greatest tragedy of our lifetime. https://t.co/aB8Okhzjkp

@BlackSapote Most of them have no clue about his background or what he has done for medicine. Their knowledge of him is related to the misinformation that has been spread during the politicization of this pandemic which is what is concerning.

@TimothyVojta #COVID19 is not endemic right now. A virus is not endemic when it causing record numbers of cases and deaths and straining our healthcare systems. 

And however much we all want Omicron to be the end of the pandemic, it won't be because we need to vaccinate billions of people

Please take #COVID19 seriously https://t.co/Y4IssgPhb3

@DracutWatch They are different viruses, different pathophysiology, different virulence - not all respiratory viral illnesses cause a post viral condition. The better question is why COVID causes post COVID-19 condition - there is a lot of research going on in this area to further understand

This is really unfortunate because #COVID19 is NOT #Influenza 

Amongst all the reasons why, Influenza does not cause a post infectious syndrome like Post COVID-19 Syndrome which can cause long term pulmonary, neurological and cognitive dysfunction 

https://t.co/clh1nmA6nI

@jabarocas @IDDocJen @sdbaral I agree with Jen - the issue is supply at this point. I spent over a week trying to find RDT - when I felt poorly after #Booster and wasn't sure if I had #COVID19 I was unable to schedule test for > 1 week. Luckily got RDT from sister and was negative - should not be this hard.

I can't believe I need to say this but do NOT try to get #COVID19 - this virus can kill you.
